node.title: Sure, Brut deodorant sprays recalled nationwide due to benzene
node.description: Analysis finds "unexpected levels" of human carcinogen coming from propellant that sprays product out of the can.
node.content: ["Sure and Brut aerosol deodorant sprays sold nationwide are being recalled due to the presence of benzene, a cancer-causing chemical, according to a notice posted by the Food and Drug Administration.", "The recall includes all lot numbers with expiration dates on or before August 2023, TCP Hot Acquisition dba HRB Brands, which markets the products, stated Wednesday in a news release.", "\"While benzene is not an ingredient in any of the recalled products, our review showed that unexpected levels of benzene came from the propellant that sprays the product out of the can,\" TCP said.\u00a0", "The consumer products company sold its personal care business to HRB Brands in 2021 for $44.7 million in cash.", "Classified as a human carcinogen, benzene can be inhaled or absorbed through skin, resulting in cancers including leukemia, as well as life-threatening blood disorders, the recall stated.", "Widely used in manufacturing, benzene is present throughout the environment and can cause cancer with repeated exposure, according\u00a0to\u00a0the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.\u00a0", "Consumers were urged to stop using the recalled products. Those with questions can call (866) 615-0976 or request a refund at www.brutsurerecall2022.com.", "The five products impacted by the recall are:", "A sixth product was distributed in Canada:", "Last year, more than half a dozen products were recalled due to benzene, including six brands of Procter & Gamble dry shampoo and conditioner spray products.\u00a0", "Other prior recalls include\u00a0five\u00a0sunscreen products by Coppertone, found to contain benzene in late September, while\u00a0Johnson & Johnson in July recalled\u00a0five of its sunscreens found to contain benzene. Another\u00a0expanded\u00a0recall\u00a0involved hand sanitizer sprays found to contain benzene.", "For Breaking News & Analysis Download the Free CBS News app"]
